meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prickly.
meanings.sent1: The cactus's prickliness made it difficult to touch.
meanings.sent2: I avoided the prickliness of the thorny bushes in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The hedgehog's prickliness seemed to say, 'Don't hug me!'
meanings.sent4: Her prickliness was like a shield, keeping others at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The prickliness of the porcupine's quills was a natural defense mechanism.

meanings.definition: The tendency to cause irritation or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: His prickliness towards criticism often led to arguments.
meanings.sent2: The prickliness of the wool sweater made her skin itch.
meanings.sent3: Despite his prickliness, he always had a kind heart.
meanings.sent4: The prickliness of the situation made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The prickliness of the new fabric caused a rash on her skin.
